## 1. Install

Install [Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/) first,

Install showmaker from [release page](https://github.com/jhk0530/showmaker/releases) to download

## 2. Markdown Files

### Header

- Header **must** include `title`, `author`, `format`, `embed-resources` like below

```markdown
---
title: "This is title"
author: "Author"
format: revealjs
embed-resources: true
---
```

You can use `revealjs`(HTML), `pptx`(pptx), `beamer`(pdf) for format.

However, `beamer` requires to install additional tool, so I strongly recommend to use `revealjs `to render HTML and print or save it as PDF.


### Body

- Each page will divided by `#` and conatin content with `-`

```markdown
# Title of page1

- A
- B

# Title of Page2

- C
- D
```

For more information, see [Quarto presentation](https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/)

## 4. Usage

> Below figure is based on v0.2.3

The main button is `upload`, If this button is not available, please install [Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/) and re-launch application.

<img src='images/1.png' width ='100%'>

Then upload your markdown file. You can upload `.md` file only. After upload markdown file, the second button will appear, it will render and let you download result file.

<img src='images/2.png' width = '100%'>

The result file will have same name with upload file. In the example, format used `pptx`.

<img src='images/3.png' width = '100%'>

There's additional buttons in Right Top. Each shows Homepage, Version of `showmaker` and User manual.

<img src='images/4.png' width = '100%'>
